oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Gay Time - 1948-04-17 - Part 11
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Inaugural Gay Time radio show, April 17, 1948, part 11. Featuring host Connie B. Gay and producer Bob Keefe; with performers Chubby Wise, the Radio Ranchmen led by Clyde Moody, Pete Cassell, the Wheeler Brothers (Joe and Buddy), Vic Johnson (name unconfirmed), the Darnell Sisters, Frank Robinson, the Free State Ramblers, the Blue Melody Boys (Harold Dent and Harold Byram), Grandpa Jones, Bob Dean and the Southern Serenaders with 'Hink', Tex Cherry, the Ralph Case Square Dancers, the Georgia Boys including 'Smitty' and 'Smiley' (names unconfirmed), tap dance group Bill Towne and his Memphis Belle Boys (names unconfirmed), Pete Foster, Slim Stuart (name unconfirmed), and T. Texas Tyler; as well as a message from Millard West, the vice-president of the American Cancer campaign of Washington, D.C. Broadcast by WWDC-FM; held at Constitution Hall, Washington, D.C. It is announced that Hank Penny and Hawkshaw Hawkins will appear on the following week's show.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: T. Texas Tyler
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Beautiful Morning Glory (T. Texas Tyler) -- Connie B. Gay talks -- Oklahoma Hills (T. Texas Tyler) -- T. Texas Tyler talks -- The Old Country Church (T. Texas Tyler) -- T. Texas Tyler talks -- In My Little Red Book (T. Texas Tyler) -- T. Texas Tyler thanks the audience -- Deck Of Cards (T. Texas Tyler)
